Question_1.Context: The study focused on the influence of hub geometry on the performance of a centrifugal fan. The researchers explored different hub configurations to determine the impact on overall efficiency and head coefficient.
Question_1.Question: What was the average improvement in overall efficiency observed for various ellipsoidal hub configurations over the hub-less base configuration?
Question_1.Source: It is found from Fig. 12 that there is an improvement in overall efficiency for the ellipsoidal hub configurations over that of the hub-less base configuration at all volume coefficients considered in the experimental work. An average improvement of about 7.3% is observed for various ellipsoidal hub configurations over the hub-less configuration at design point operation of the fan.

Question_2.Context: The study compared the performance of optimized hemi-spherical and ellipsoidal hub configurations in terms of overall efficiency and relative theoretical efficiency.
Question_2.Question: Which hub configuration showed a consistent improvement of about 11% in overall efficiency over the optimum hemi-spherical hub model?
Question_2.Source: It is found that optimum ellipsoidal configuration (E5) shows a consistent improvement of about 11% in overall efficiency over that of the optimum hemi-spherical hub model (S3) for the range of volume coefficients considered.

Question_3.Context: The study developed correlations for the optimized hub-shape configuration to predict head coefficient and relative theoretical efficiency.
Question_3.Question: What is the regression coefficient for the correlation obtained for head coefficient in Eq. (11)?
Question_3.Source: The regression data of head coefficient for the correlation obtained in Eq. (11) has regression coefficient of 0.93 and average absolute deviation of 0.8%.

Question_4.Context: The study investigated the influence of hub geometry on the performance of a centrifugal fan.
Question_4.Question: What was the average improvement in head coefficient observed for various ellipsoidal hub configurations over the hub-less base configuration?
Question_4.Source: It is discernable that hub configurations are found to yield relatively higher head coefficient values when compared with the hub-less base configuration at all volume coefficients. An average improvement of about 3.6% is observed for hub configurations over the hub-less base configuration at design point.

Question_5.Context: The study developed correlations for the optimized hub-shape configuration to predict head coefficient and relative theoretical efficiency.
Question_5.Question: What is the average absolute deviation for the regression data of relative theoretical efficiency in the correlation obtained in Eq. (12)?
Question_5.Source: The regression data of relative theoretical efficiency for the correlation obtained in Eq. (12) has regression coefficient of 0.89 and average absolute deviation of 4.9%.

Question_6.Context: The study compared the performance of optimized hemi-spherical and ellipsoidal hub configurations in terms of relative theoretical efficiency.
Question_6.Question: Which hub configuration showed a significant improvement of about 3.5% in relative theoretical efficiency over the optimum hemi-spherical hub model?
Question_6.Source: The optimum ellipsoidal configuration E5 shows a significant improvement of about 3.5% in relative theoretical efficiency over that of the optimum hemi-spherical hub model (S3) for various volume coefficients used.

Question_7.Context: The study developed correlations for the optimized hub-shape configuration to predict head coefficient and relative theoretical efficiency.
Question_7.Question: What is the regression coefficient for the correlation obtained for relative theoretical efficiency in Eq. (12)?
Question_7.Source: The regression data of relative theoretical efficiency for the correlation obtained in Eq. (12) has regression coefficient of 0.89 and average absolute deviation of 4.9%.

Question_8.Context: The study investigated the influence of hub geometry on the performance of a centrifugal fan.
Question_8.Question: What was the improvement in head coefficient observed for the ellipsoidal hub configuration E5 over the hub-less base configuration?
Question_8.Source: Configuration E5 provides adequate convergence over the hub surface and enters the impeller with minimum incidence and friction losses. This helps in bettering the head coefficient by about 7.5% for configuration E5 over the hub-less base configuration.

Question_9.Context: The study compared the performance of optimized hemi-spherical and ellipsoidal hub configurations in terms of overall efficiency.
Question_9.Question: Which hub configuration showed a consistent improvement of about 11% in relative theoretical efficiency over the optimum hemi-spherical hub model?
Question_9.Source: The optimum ellipsoidal configuration (E5) shows a significant improvement of about 3.5% in relative theoretical efficiency over that of the optimum hemi-spherical hub model (S3) for various volume coefficients used.

Question_10.Source: The regression data of head coefficient for the correlation obtained in Eq. (11) has regression coefficient of 0.93 and average absolute deviation of 0.8%.
